entry.title: Threat Intel Automation
entry.content:
title: â€œAutomated Threat Intelligence with Pythonâ€ date: 2025-05-02 categories: [Cybersecurity, Threat Intelligence] tags: [python, APIs, threat-data, security-automation] â€”

ğŸ•µğŸ¾â€â™‚ï¸ Threat Intel Project: Building an Automated Threat Feed Harvester

Part of the Cybersecurity Projects series.
In this post, Iâ€™ll break down how I built a Python-based automation tool to collect and log threat intelligence from multiple sources â€” specifically, VirusTotal, AlienVault OTX, and AbuseIPDB.

The goal was simple:
ğŸ¯ Build a script that could pull data from real-world threat feeds and save it locally for analysis or future use.

ğŸ§  Why Threat Intelligence?

Threat intelligence is a critical pillar in cybersecurity. Itâ€™s what gives SOC teams the edge â€” knowing what IPs, hashes, or domains are up to no good before they reach your network. While there are expensive commercial solutions, most of these sources offer public APIs, and with a little Python, we can tap directly into them ourselves.

This project helped me learn:

  • How to work with REST APIs
  • How to safely handle and log sensitive data
  • How to automate data collection from multiple threat sources

ğŸ› ï¸ Tools & Data Sources

Here are the threat intel feeds I integrated:

  • ğŸ”¬ VirusTotal: File hash and domain reputation service.
  • ğŸ›°ï¸ AlienVault OTX: Community-powered threat indicators (IOCs).
  • ğŸ›¡ï¸ AbuseIPDB: A growing blacklist of malicious IPs based on community reports.

All of these platforms offer free API access with usage limits.

ğŸ§ª How It Works

1. ğŸ“ Project Structure

Threat-Intelligence/
â”œâ”€â”€ src/
â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ vt_query.py        # VirusTotal logic
â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ otx_query.py       # AlienVault logic
â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ abuseipdb_query.py # AbuseIPDB logic
â”‚   â””â”€â”€ main.py            # Orchestrates the full run
â”œâ”€â”€ .env.example           # API key template
â”œâ”€â”€ requirements.txt       # Python deps (requests, python-dotenv, etc.)
â”œâ”€â”€ README.md              # Project documentation

2. ğŸ”‘ Secure API Access

To avoid hardcoding sensitive keys, I used a .env file (ignored by Git). Hereâ€™s what the template looks like:

VT_API_KEY=your_virustotal_key
OTX_API_KEY=your_otx_key
ABUSEIPDB_API_KEY=your_abuseipdb_key

3. ğŸ“¦ Output

Each module stores results in:

  • results/virustotal.json
  • results/otx.json
  • results/abuseipdb.json

Thereâ€™s also support for saving in CSV format for those who prefer Excel-style review.

ğŸ“¸ Screenshots (Coming Soon)

Iâ€™ll be adding screenshots of:

  • API responses in JSON format
  • Terminal output after running the main script
  • Sample results in Excel

ğŸ§© Lessons Learned

  • Some APIs rate-limit hard. Solution: rotate queries or introduce time.sleep().
  • OTX gives a lot of raw data â€” parsing and extracting useful fields was key.
  • I used logging instead of print() to track runs and errors in production-style output.

ğŸš€ Future Enhancements

  • Add Shodan or URLScan as additional sources
  • Convert it into a CLI tool with argument parsing
  • Build a basic dashboard to visualize results using Flask or Streamlit
  • Schedule as a daily cron job for passive data collection

ğŸ“ Repo Link

All code and instructions are in the GitHub repo:
https://github.com/GreyKeyStudios/CyberSecurity-Projects/tree/main/Threat-Intelligence
entry.summary: title: â€œAutomated Threat Intelligence with Pythonâ€ date: 2025-05-02 categories: [Cybersecurity, Threat Intelligence] tags: [python, APIs, threat-data, security-automation] â€”

entry.title: Passion Lost and Found, Maybe
entry.content:
Music & Audio Projects

Songs, tools, and experiments in original production.

This post is a brief synopsis of my journey back into music and a preview of some upcoming projects.

A Personal Journey

Music has always been my main passion. Iâ€™ve been creating music since I was a teenager, but after a few personal tragedies, I took a long break. I eventually got back into itâ€”tentatively. I created a fictional label and artist roster to help me explore different sounds and genres without being tied down to a single identity.

The first album I released was a mixed bag of old beats Iâ€™d been sitting on. It was rushedâ€”more of a tribute to my mom and cousin Quincy. My mother nurtured the creative spirit in me early and always did her best to keep something musical around me. Quincy was the biggest supporter of my music, and was my greatest teacher when it came to beat-making unbeknownst to everyone. He was murdered in 2011, and his death marked the start of a long period of depression and anxiety that still lingers today.

I released the project on my momâ€™s birthday. She passed from cancer two years later, and sadly never got to hear the album.

Losing the Spark

From 2015 to 2024, my creative output slowed to a crawl. Where I used to make five beats a day in high school, now I couldnâ€™t even finish one. A hard drive crash wiped out most of my sample-based catalogâ€”over 2,000 beats. I tried to rebuild from scratch, avoiding samples, but nothing felt right.

My anxiety made it nearly impossible to create. Some days Iâ€™d force out a track, but it always sounded â€œoffâ€ to me. After the loss of my mother, father and cousin, a bad breakup and the loss of a child, I stopped making music entirely.

I attempted a comeback in 2020 during quarantineâ€”right after a full-blown mental breakdown in 2019. It was rough, but it planted a seed. In the past year or two, Iâ€™ve slowly become grounded again. Now, Iâ€™m finally creating with purpose.

Why This Blog Exists

This blog is part diary, part digital lab notebook. Itâ€™s where Iâ€™ll document my return to music and my progress in technologyâ€”particularly in IT, which I got into because of music.

I created Grey Key Studios as the fictional label housing all my pseudonyms and musical styles. Itâ€™s not a real label (yet), just a central hub for everything I make.

Artist Roster

Each persona serves a different genre or concept. Hereâ€™s a breakdown:

The Beautiful Uglies â€” Neo Soul / Psychedelic / Experimental

  • The original project name for my first album.
  • A fictional â€œbandâ€ that could one day become real.
  • Musical vibe: raw, genre-blending, emotionally charged.

Bio: This is the pseudonym I released my first album under. I was originally going to release everything under that name. I think it was the way the first album was non-cohesive that made me create the other artists when i got back into music.

It was always supposed to be a fictional band that could morph into a real band, and it still is really. I am an intermediate keyboardist and struggle with guitar, bass and drums so making something that sounds like a band is really hard but I try lol. Hopefully one day I will actually have a band of my own.

Mr. E. â€” ???

  • Say it fast ğŸ˜‰
  • Mysterious persona for unknown vibes.

Bio:???

Mic Titan â€” Hip Hop Instrumentals / Remixes

  • My first producer and rap name.
  • Retired after my cousinâ€™s death but revived for future boom-bap and sample-flip projects.

Bio: This was my first producer name, It doubled as my rap name back when i thought i could rap lol. I gave up that name around the same time my cousin died. I just didnâ€™t like the name anymore and hip hopâ€™s coffin was already being lowered so i planned to go a different route.

Thatâ€™s when The Beautiful Uglies was created shortly before he died. I plan to start making hip hop beats again with and without sample. Now that tools like Tracklib are around i plan to flip something crazy hopefully.

Walton Grey â€” Post-Rock / Bedroom Pop

  • My â€œexperimental indieâ€ outlet.
  • Inspired by Stereolab, Tortoise, The Sea and Cake, and similar artists.
  • Iâ€™ll be â€œsingingâ€ hereâ€”thanks, AI.

Bio: While i was away from making music I think it made me a better fan. I started listening to more genres of music and one of the ones I fell in love with was rock. There were a few rock songs that I liked when i was younger but it wasnâ€™t in my regular rotation. I did discover a lot of great older stuff looking for sampled when I was younger but nothing that I would bump daily. I discovered so many artists that amaze me from so many different genres.

Back in 2007 I really got into Post rock with groups like Stereolab, Tortoise, The Sea and Cake, and The High Llamas. There were a few other groups that I liked but those were the stand outs and got heavy rotation. During the long hiatus iâ€™ve found other groups outside of my elite 4 of more modern rock listed above. too many to list.

It became one of my favorite genres. The same things that I like about hip hop and jazz are present in a lot of this music. Really I like almost anything jazz influenced, so when I say rock itâ€™s probably not the rock youâ€™re thinking of lol. I also plan to sing on the Walton Grey projects so wish me the best of luck cause I donâ€™t sing, so with the power of AI I might be able to make my terrible voice work lol.

Adwo Nyumbani â€” Jazz / Jazz Fusion (Pronounced â€œAHJOâ€)

  • This project is calm, meditative, and hopefully convincing thanks to tools like vHorns.

Bio: Jazz has always been in a rotating spot of 1A and 1B with Hip Hop for my favorite genre of music. I hated Jazz up until i was 11 years old. I was listening to Jazz 88 FM and heard a song that blew my mind. iâ€™ve been a jazz fan ever since.

Iâ€™ve tried to create jazz since i start making music but never had a band. with my limited skills its pretty hard to make realistic sounding jazz in a DAW. but with modern plugins i think i can at least if not make it sound real. make it sound Jazz.

The Bobbie Backfat Band â€” Funk

  • Because I needed a funk band. Might only release one album, but itâ€™ll be funky.

Bio: TBD

The Broken Shortcuts â€” Covers

  • A place for covers Iâ€™ve always wanted to make across different genres.

Bio: TDB

you can find the â€œrealâ€ bios for these artists on my website greykeystudios.com.

Upcoming Projects

Hereâ€™s what Iâ€™m working on right now:

ğŸµ Private Karate

Artist: Walton Grey

Theme: A musical battle with anxiety and depression

  • 24 songs written, aiming for 10â€“12 on the final album
  • Rock-inspired with vocals (yes, Iâ€™m singing)

Snippet:

This album was initially on the back burner since iâ€™ve never really made a rock project before, but the songs just kept coming out. Iâ€™m up to 24 tracks written and I hope to dwindle it down to the best 10-12. I will be â€œsingingâ€ on the Walton Grey projects so though most of the music beds are finished and lyrics written, the vocals remain to be recorded. Still a ways before itâ€™s out but itâ€™s the closest to completion.

ğŸ¥ Winter â€“ Music Video (AI-Generated)

Tools Used: Suno, Sora, NightCafe, Trellis

  • A track from Private Karate turned into a visual
  • Winter is personified as an icy anti-hero that returns each year to haunt the town

Pics:

Video:

There is a song on the Private Karate Album where Winter is a person who comes to town every year and terrorizes the place lol. I decided to try and make a music video for it with AI.

ğŸ¸ Untitled 80s Album

Artist: Walton Grey

Vibe: 80s nostalgia

  • Touching genres like synth-pop, R&B, and lo-fi sci-fi
  • No lyrics yet, but strong progress on the instrumentals

Snippet:

I have 3 Walton Grey projects in the works. a rock album, this one with more 80s aesthetic, and a neo soul joint project with The Beautiful Uglies. Since the rock project has been coming along so well I havenâ€™t written any lyrics for this one, but i made a good amount of music for it. Iâ€™ll try to touch a few 80s genres from pop, to soul, to r&b, to whatever that weird scifi movie intro music from that time was lol.

ğŸ· Calm Home

Artist: Adwo Nyumbani

Vibe: Chill, mellow jazz

  • Hoping to simulate a live feel with plugins like vHorns

Snippet:

ğŸŒ™ Midnight

Artist: The Beautiful Uglies

Concept: A journey through each hour of the night

  • Each track will be named after a specific hour (e.g., 1:00 AM, 3:45 AM)

Snippet:

ğŸ•¹ Games On Channel 3

Artist: Mr. E

Concept: SNES soundfonts + original compositions

  • Like a lost retro game soundtrack

ğŸŒ€ Soundtrack for an Unmade Film (10th Anniversary)

Artist: The Beautiful Uglies

Concept: The first project, remastered and re-released

  • A raw, genre-defying mix of early beats and emotionsâ€¦â€¦â€¦(lol)

My first album, remastered (as best as I could) and re-released on its 10th anniversary. It was a messâ€”but it was honest.

ğŸŒ€ Destination: Terra Gaia Album

Artist: Mr. E

Concept: Mr. E embarks on a planet of the apes like journey on a planet run by robots.

This is the First Mr. E release. I used public domain samples and AI voiceovers to tell a story across the tracks. Iâ€™ll eventually add visuals to match.

ğŸ· 1899 Waltz-Single

Artist: Adwo Nyumbani

Vibe: Chill, mellow jazz, breakbeat

This is the first thing released from Adwo Nyumbani. It wasnâ€™t as traditional as it was intended to be when i started making it but I figured instead of dwelling trying to make this one thing perfect. I should probably keep it moving because i have a lot of music to make.

Whatâ€™s Next?

Thereâ€™s more in the worksâ€”including production tools and educational projects. Iâ€™ll document everything here, one post at a time.

entry.title: A Swim Through Syslog
entry.content:
ğŸ§  What This Project Was

This post walks through a Splunk syslog monitoring lab I built as part of my cybersecurity learning journey. The goal was to simulate a mini-SOC environment and get hands-on with log ingestion, parsing, and visualizations using Splunk.

ğŸ› ï¸ Tools Used

  • Splunk Enterprise (Free Trial)
  • Kali Linux VM
  • Syslog sources: /var/log/auth.log, /var/log/syslog
  • Dashboard Studio (Classic & Modern panels)

ğŸ” Project Goals

  • Ingest and monitor syslog + auth logs
  • Create dashboards for:
    • Failed login attempts
    • Sudo command activity
    • Event trends by source
  • Generate test log events and confirm ingestion

ğŸ“¸ Dashboard Panels

ğŸ”‘ 1. Failed Login Attempts

Bar chart showing failed logins by user and host.

ğŸ§¾ 2. Sudo Commands Executed

Table of executed sudo commands with counts.

ğŸ“ˆ 3. Live Event Trends

Line graph showing syslog event frequency over time.

ğŸ” Key Search Queries

Here are the actual Splunk queries powering these panels:

ğŸ” Failed Logins

```spl index=* sourcetype=linux_secure â€œFailed passwordâ€ | stats count by user, host

index=* source=â€/var/log/auth.logâ€ â€œsudoâ€ | rex â€œCOMMAND=(?.*)â€ | stats count by user, command

ğŸ§  Lessons Learned Real-time log tailing helped validate pipeline setup

Regex is essential for extracting command fields

Splunkâ€™s visualization and alerting tools are powerful once configured

Troubleshooting ingestion was the biggest time sink (auth.log visibility issues)

âœ… Next Steps Add Splunk alerts for brute-force attempts

Monitor DNS or iptables logs

Export logs to another SIEM like Wazuh or Graylog

This lab was one of the most hands-on and visual parts of my security learning journey so far.
entry.summary: Exploring syslog monitoring and dashboarding in Splunk through a practical security lab.

entry.title: Welcome to the Grey Key Blog

link.title: Welcome to the Grey Key Blog

entry.content:
Welcome to the Grey Key Blog

Welcome to the official blog of Grey Key Studios â€” a space where I document my creative and technical projects across cybersecurity, music production, AI development, and indie game design.

This blog exists as both a living resume and a personal lab notebook. Here, youâ€™ll find deep dives into what Iâ€™m working on, what Iâ€™m learning, what goes wrong (often), and how I solve it. Every post reflects real work that you can find in my GitHub repositories, complete with code, configs, screenshots, and lessons learned.

ğŸ¯ What This Blog Covers

This blog will cover three major areas:

ğŸ” Cybersecurity Projects

Iâ€™m currently studying for certifications and building projects to break into the field. These include:

  • SOC dashboards (like the Splunk syslog monitoring lab)
  • Threat detection labs
  • Log parsing scripts
  • Infrastructure as Code

ğŸµ Music & AI Experiments

Music is therapy and expression. I document:

  • Original songs (lyrics, production, video)
  • Music education tools built with AI
  • VST plugin development
  • Vocal cloning and Synthesizer V workflows

ğŸ® Game & App Development

Iâ€™m building creative tools and games like:

  • A Blaxploitation-inspired fighting game (Cooleyâ€™s Revenge)
  • Interactive audio apps
  • Browser-based learning tools for music & cyber concepts

ğŸš§ Why Iâ€™m Doing This

Like many creators and career-changers, Iâ€™ve struggled to find the â€œrightâ€ way to showcase what I know. Iâ€™m not a traditional resume kind of person â€” I learn by doing. This blog lets me:

  • Document my process
  • Show my work
  • Improve my skills
  • Share what I learn

Iâ€™m not aiming to go viral. Iâ€™m aiming to get better, get noticed, and maybe help a few others on the way.

ğŸ§ª Whatâ€™s Coming Up

Hereâ€™s a glimpse of upcoming blog posts:

  • âœ… Splunk Syslog Monitoring Lab (SOC-style dashboard on Kali Linux)
  • ğŸ›ï¸ Building an AI Music Plugin with JUCE + Web Tech
  • ğŸ‘ŠğŸ¾ Designing Characters for a 70s-Style Fighting Game
  • ğŸ” Threat Detection with Python & Docker

Each project will get its own dedicated post, with updates as I make progress.

Thanks for reading.
Letâ€™s build.

â€” Grey Key Studios
entry.summary: Welcome to the Grey Key Blog
